abstract.t: This document specifies an IP-based encapsulation for MPLS, called MPLS-in-UDP (User Datagram Protocol) for situations where UDP encapsulation is preferred to direct use of MPLS, e.g., to enable UDP-based ECMP (Equal Cost Multi-Pathing) or link aggregation. MPLS- in-UDP is primarily applicable to service provider networks, and additional restrictions apply to MPLS-in-UDP usage for traffic that is not congestion controlled and to UDP zero checksum usage with IPv6.
